author: A Wil
reviewBody: Not Verified |  | I fly a decent amount for work so I have gone to the TSA in a lot of airports in the USA yet, somehow Cleveland TSA seems to go out of their way to be rude, obnoxious, and, slow. This last time they confused a portable monitor for a tablet and got annoyed at me for their ignorance, and said I had four laptops. I had just one laptop for work and a small tablet. I have been the TSA at BNA, ATL, GSP, ORD, SFO, ONT, MKE, and Monteray (MEX) with the same gear this year without a problem. Yet Cleveland TSA has got to be obnoxious about it. The Airline ground staff at Cleveland has always been amazing, especially with Delta, and United, friendly helpful, and present, in my opinion, they make up for a lot of the facility's shortcomings.

author: Barry DiJulius
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Flew back in December from Hopkins and spent 90 minutes in line for security. Today, 3/3/24, I checked my bags and saw that the line for security was the entire length of the airport! While we were waiting in line, we were offered “CLEAR” for a faster way through security. We never would have made our 10:50am flight, despite arriving at 8am. So, we spent the large sum of money on “CLEAR” to ensure our vacation was not ruined. The people in security used the excuse that traffic was high for spring break. I didn’t see any groups of young people that looked like they were going to a beach. Spring break is still a week or two away! The problem is poor staffing and planning. I use to fly twice a week through Hopkins for 12 years and never experienced the ridiculousness that I experienced in December and again today. This is the age of “It is no one’s fault and no one takes ownership.” Remember when Cleveland was the best location in the nation? Well, the Plum has worms!

author: D Kovacs
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Cleveland airport is awful. Dirty disgusting bathrooms all the time, trash outside and cigarettes. No pride at all. I’m embarrassed when I have people come here as this is my home.

author: Tom Mack
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Parking is inadequate and chaotic, understaffed. Late inbounds flights frequently have no gate crews so you get in late, then wait even longer. Very user unfriendly.

author: K McDermid
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Getting in yesterday was ok except for having to walk great distances when my partner and I have hip issues. Being offered a ride on an electric cart that did not happen. Then today we sat in the check in area for more the an hour waiting for someone to push our wheelchairs to our gate. We were taken to the head of the line only to have to wait. But everyone was very nice.

author: C Hastel
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I fly 2-3 times a month throughout the U.S. for work. Every time I go through security at Cleveland is unnecessary slow and some issue with TSA. They are the rudest agents that look for problems and overreact to everything. I fly LAX and ATL frequently with no issues ever. This trip out of Cleveland they wanted to do a full pat down because a coin sized yellow dot came up in my jeans pocket area when I went through the x-ray machine. I asked to check my pockets and go back through and they refused, used intimidation tactics of getting in my face to make me submit to a pat down. I refused and was kicked out. Checked my pocket and a penny had snuck up in crease. You would think professional TSA agents would be able to recognize a coin when they see it and not subject a traveler to be felt up. Other airports wouldn’t have done that. They also wouldn’t allow me to touch my cleared luggage or purse until I submitted to pat down. Complete harassment on every level.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2022', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Jeff
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I have been flying again for business and Cleveland Hopkins is the only airport where you can land and sit and wait 20-40 minutes for a gate to open up. It’s ridiculous.

author: C Stewart
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I travel frequently and have found few airports as poorly run as CLE. I would much prefer to use Canton/Akron but end up using CLE when the deal is just too good to pass up. I flew out this past Saturday and watched a bunch of employees walk around with little idea of how to get a crowd through security while employing some type of social distancing. One woman walked around simply shouting "6 feet" and an employee standing in the CLEAR aisle actually argued with a customer about why CLE just wasn't prepared for the crowd that morning. I do not pay for pre-check, but the gentleman in front of me did, and he was irate that there wasn't even a pre-flight aisle open and he was stuck in the same inefficient line with the rest of us. I returned to CLE from Orlando and experienced none of the problems there that I did at Cleveland Hopkins.

author: P Clark
reviewBody: Not Verified |  We waited two hours for our baggage. The entire flight had to wait two hours. This is absolutely unacceptable. We were so excited to land at 11.06pm and be able to get home a little earlier.

author: E Bell
reviewBody: Not Verified | Why did they move the shuttle service so far away? In order to get to ticketing or from baggage carousels, you have to go down one escalator, with your bags in tow, then drag them to the next escalator to go up. Then you have a long walk to get to your shuttle! Not convenient for a 66 year old woman who travels alone. Please return the shuttles back down to the arrival area.

author: T Hueni
reviewBody: Not Verified | Terrible. Food, people, etc. everything is terrible. Landed here at 6 and didn’t get bags until 9. Security before getting on plane and after. Baggage claim numbers are wrong. Do not come here unless you have no other choice.

author: W Davis
reviewBody: Not Verified |  While going through security check we placed our boarding passes in the bin with our shoes, purse, belt, etc. When the bins came out of the check point our boarding passes were gone. I immediately notified an employee who was working at this particular security clearance gate. He looked around the the scanner and underneath it as well, and told us we would have to get new boarding passes printed at out departure gate. Inconvenient and frustrating, but even worse was the attitude and disrespect this employee displayed. Wondering how they can claim to screen for weapons, etc., yet lose 2 boarding passes before their very eyes?
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'July 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Sue Martin
reviewBody: Customs is horrible here. We had to wait to get our luggage and then we all stood in a mob style type line with one person checking our photos. Then we got the pleasure to stand in another line waiting for a shuttle that arrives every so often. Now they are loading elders into a wheelchair and can seem to not load any other people. Maybe there should be more than one shuttle or let us walk through a concourse. This is ridiculous.

header: "what was the purpose of the major remodel?"
author: Thomas Berle
reviewBody: The new procedure for passenger transportation unloading while using busses or parking busses is terrible. That is a lot of walking to do to get to baggage check. What was the purpose of the major remodel? To make the airport less traveler friendly? Because that is exactly what they have done. Hopkins is one of the worst operated and managed airports in the country. I will in the future try to avoid this inconvenience by using CAK as much as possible. Thanks Hopkins operational managers. Fix this now.

author: Penny Sherrod
reviewBody: My flight was delayed 4 hours so my husband and I decided to go and smoke in the ouside sitting area. Great area, quiet, breezy but still warm from the sun. The only problem was that all of the benches were filthy. The garbage hadn't been emptied. Just all together filthy.

author: Therese Penland
reviewBody: My experience using Cleveland Airport - the employees were friendly and helpful. Security went smoothly and they were helpful as I was traveling with a 2 month old infant. The parking garage however needs some serious attention. The current signs are misleading in helping passengers to find their car. After looking and becoming extremely frustrated one of the employees at the ticket booth told us where to look. This is why I prefer Akron/Canton every time over Cleveland.

author: V Howe
reviewBody: Upon arrival assistance was prompt, friendly and courteous. My brother and I needed wheelchair assistance and they were there and the attendant was friendly. Upon departure there was a total of 8 wheelchairs needed and they even called more attendants (6 total) to get us on the plane. Again prompt, friendly and courteous.

author: Thomas Theobald
reviewBody: I travel through here all too often. I understand they don't have much room for security lines. However my complaint is there is never ever a sense of urgency in dealing with the lines. They could be much more efficient. Sick of the horrible reviews Cleveland? Do something about it.

author: B Smith
reviewBody: Horrible security lines and set up. Terminals with zero convenient grab and go food options (plan on walking all the way back to security), it's dirty, terrible signage, inconvenient rental car location and shuttle pick up location, rude check in agents and limited parking. This airport fails in every way possible.

author: E Joseph
reviewBody: Start off by experiencing long, packed security lines. Every single time you fly out of this airport, day or night. Then walk down the dated concourse where the bathroom cleanliness is lacking. When you need to pick someone up from this airport you can expect to be greeted by rude Cleveland Police Officers who walk up and down the pickup area with a ticket book in their hand, waiting for you to stay too long in the pick up area. I had one banging on my window yelling me to move my car. Haven't seen another airport where police officers or staff act like this. What a terrible and depressing all around experience at this airport.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Dubuc
reviewBody: The security checkpoint setup in the main terminal is terrible. Congested too few lanes waits that require you to stand on steps. I flew through CLE two years ago and I thought then I hit the occasional bad day. Flew through yesterday was worse though not really that busy. What was really disappointing is that nothing has been done in two years to improve the situation. It's way past the time knowing these security stations are going to be a permanent requirement so Airport mgt needs to step up and get some over due renovations done. In addition the restrooms in concourse A are undersized narrow halls to get into then way too small with too few facilities. The rest rooms and security the Airport can do something about. The last comment has to do with the location of the car rental facility. Common sense would have had the facility as close to the airport as possible for customer convenience along the main road but no site selection put the at the end of a dead end street the bus passing empty acreage which would have been much more convenient.
stats: {'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}
